plugin_desc: The K8S monitoring plugin is used to monitor the status and health of Kubernetes clusters, including the performance metrics of nodes, containers, and pods.

metrics.name: cluster_pod_count
metrics.description: It is used to count the total number of Pods currently present in the Kubernetes cluster. This metric returns the count of Pods running in the cluster, including those across all namespaces

metrics.name: cluster_node_count
metrics.description: It is used to count the total number of nodes currently available in the Kubernetes cluster. This metric returns the number of nodes in the cluster, helping users understand the scale and resources of the cluster

metrics.name: cluster_cpu_utilization
metrics.description: Represents the current CPU utilization of the cluster, typically expressed as a percentage

metrics.name: cluster_memory_utilization
metrics.description: Shows the current memory utilization of the cluster, expressed as a percentage

metrics.name: prometheus_remote_write_kube_pod_status_phase
metrics.description: Retrieves the current status of the Pod, such as Running, Stopped, etc.

metrics.name: prometheus_remote_write_kube_pod_container_status_restarts_total
metrics.description: Monitors the restart counts of containers in the Pod to assess stability and frequency of issues

metrics.name: pod_cpu_utilization
metrics.description: Calculates the CPU utilization of a Pod, reflecting the difference between container CPU limits and requests

metrics.name: pod_memory_utilization
metrics.description: Calculates the memory utilization of the Pod as a ratio of memory limits to requests

metrics.name: prometheus_remote_write_container_fs_writes_total
metrics.description: This metric represents the rate of I/O write operations performed by a specific Pod, helping analyze the write demands of the application on the storage system

metrics.name: pod_io_reads_rate
metrics.description: This metric represents the rate of I/O read operations performed by a specific Pod, helping analyze the read demands of the application on the storage system

metrics.name: pod_network_in_rate
metrics.description: Monitors the inbound network traffic rate of a Pod, calculated based on the number of containers and IPs

metrics.name: pod_network_out_rate
metrics.description: Monitors the outbound network traffic rate of a Pod, calculated based on the number of containers and IPs

metrics.name: node_status_condition
metrics.description: Node Status indicates the current operational state of the node, such as "Running" or "Stopped." It helps administrators monitor and manage nodes within the Kubernetes cluster

metrics.name: node_cpu_utilization
metrics.description: CPU Utilization indicates the current usage level of the node's CPU relative to its total available CPU resources. Monitoring this metric helps identify CPU bottlenecks and optimize resource allocation

metrics.name: node_cpu_idle_rate
metrics.description: Displays the CPU idle rate, representing the amount of unused CPU resources in the system. It helps to know if the system is under high load. This metric is crucial for analyzing system performance and efficiency

metrics.name: node_cpu_iowait_rate
metrics.display_name: Percentage of Time Waiting for IO
metrics.description: Displays the percentage of CPU time spent waiting for IO operations, indicating the impact of disk or network performance on the system. Reducing wait time helps improve system performance. This metric is very useful for analyzing system bottlenecks

metrics.name: node_cpu_system_rate
metrics.description: Displays the system usage rate, showing the CPU resources consumed by kernel processes. Analyzing this value helps optimize system kernel performance and stability

metrics.name: node_cpu_user_rate
metrics.description: Displays the percentage of CPU resources used by user processes, helping understand the performance of applications and services. This metric is helpful in understanding the CPU consumption of specific applications

metrics.name: node_memory_usage
metrics.description: Application Memory Usage represents the total amount of memory utilized by applications running on the node. This metric helps understand the memory demands of applications and their impact on system performance

metrics.name: node_memory_utilization
metrics.description: Application Memory Utilization Rate is the ratio of memory used by the application to its configured memory limits. By monitoring this metric, users can determine if adjustments to memory limits are needed

metrics.name: node_disk_usage_rate
metrics.description: Displays the percentage of disk space used, helping understand the utilization of disk resources. This metric is important for preventing disk overflow

metrics.name: node_disk_used
metrics.description: Displays the actual used disk space, used to determine disk capacity usage. This metric is helpful for monitoring disk space usage

metrics.name: node_diskio_writes_rate
metrics.description: Counts the rate of data write operations to the disk in the specified time interval

metrics.name: node_diskio_write_bytes_rate
metrics.description: Counts the rate of bytes written to the disk in the specified time interval

metrics.name: node_diskio_write_time_rate
metrics.description: Counts the rate of time taken to write data to the disk in the specified time interval

metrics.name: node_diskio_reads_rate
metrics.description: Counts the rate of data read operations from the disk in the specified time interval

metrics.name: node_diskio_read_bytes_rate
metrics.description: Counts the rate of bytes read from the disk in the specified time interval

metrics.name: node_diskio_read_time_rate
metrics.description: Counts the rate of time taken to read data from the disk in the specified time interval

metrics.name: node_network_receive_rate
metrics.description: Network In refers to the rate of data traffic received through the network interface. Monitoring this metric helps analyze if network bandwidth is sufficient and the overall network performance

metrics.name: node_network_transmit_rate
metrics.description: Network Out refers to the rate of data traffic sent through the network interface. This metric helps understand the node's network egress demands and potential bottlenecks

metrics.name: node_cpu_load1
metrics.description: 1 Minute Average Load indicates the average load on the system over the last minute. This metric helps provide a real-time understanding of the system's load level

metrics.name: node_cpu_load5
metrics.description: 5 Minute Average Load indicates the average load on the system over the last 5 minutes. This metric helps identify load trends and their impact on system performance

metrics.name: node_cpu_load15
metrics.description: 15 Minute Average Load indicates the average load on the system over the last 15 minutes. Monitoring this metric helps administrators understand the long-term load state of the system
